verses.roman:
tatra snātvā mahā-bhāgā
upoṣya su-samāhitāḥ
brāhmaṇebhyo dadur dhenūr
vāsaḥ-srag-rukma-mālinīḥ

synonyms: tatra—there; snātvā—bathing; mahā-bhāgāḥ—the greatly pious (Yādavas); upoṣya—fasting; su-samāhitāḥ—with careful attention; brāhmaṇebhyaḥ—to brāhmaṇas; daduḥ—they gave; dhenūḥ—cows; vāsaḥ—with garments; srak—flower garlands; rukma—gold; mālinīḥ—and necklaces.
translation: At Samanta-pañcaka, the saintly Yādavas bathed and then observed a fast with careful attention. Afterward they presented brāhmaṇas with cows bedecked with garments, flower garlands and gold necklaces.
